titleStmt.title: Master Rigb'ys [sic] speech in answer to the Lord Finch of that he delivered before the House of Commons in behalf of himself : with a conspiracie discovered, or, the report of a committee to the House of Commons in Parliament of the examination of divers of the conspirators, and others of th late treason, June the 17th, 1641 : 1. Concerning the Tower, 2. Wherein the French are concerned in this conspiracy, 3. Of provoking the army against Parliament by false reports.
titleStmt.author: Rigby, Alexander, 1594-1650.

titleStmt.title: Master Rigb'ys [sic] speech in answer to the Lord Finch of that he delivered before the House of Commons in behalf of himself : with a conspiracie discovered, or, the report of a committee to the House of Commons in Parliament of the examination of divers of the conspirators, and others of th late treason, June the 17th, 1641 : 1. Concerning the Tower, 2. Wherein the French are concerned in this conspiracy, 3. Of provoking the army against Parliament by false reports.
titleStmt.author: Rigby, Alexander, 1594-1650.
Finch of Fordwich, John Finch, Baron, 1584-1660.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: print show-through with some loss of print.
